jobDescription: Department: Supply Chain Job Status: Full Time Reports To: Senior Manager Strategic Purchasing  JR Automation Technologies is looking for a Commodity Manager to join its growing Strategic Purchasing team. The successful candidate will be someone who has worked previously in a strategic purchasing role. This person will have strong communications skills who is able to create purchasing strategies, develop and maintain supplier relationships, and a proven ability to work with cross-functional teams. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and maintain strategic supplier relationships.Lead, develop and manage commodity strategies.Own the Preferred Supplier List for your commodity.Manage supplier issues while supporting current suppliers while developing new suppliers for your commodity as needed.Assist Business Unit (BU) Supply Chain support (SCM Manager/Buyers) in purchasing project related material, inventory tools and customer specified items.Be a resource for all JR employees, by leading and working within cross-functional teams.Create and drive cost savings initiatives.Collaborate with the quoting, engineering, project management and build teams to understand needs and drive cost effective solutions.Identify and manage risks at all levels of the supply chain.Develop and drive strategic programs focused on reducing overall cost and improving supplier engagement and performanceDemonstrated ability to negotiate.Be able to work in a global environment.Be able to communicate to all levels of the organization across all geographic regions.Conduct oneself at all times in a manner that is distinguished by a high level of professionalism and ethics.Lead continuous improvements of sourcing and purchasing processes.Engage actively in corporate lean and continuous improvement initiatives.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor degree in business, supply chain, or a related field MBA is preferredAt least 5 years of experience in a supply chain position requiredMaster (5 plus years) experience developing purchasing strategies requiredMaster (5 plus years) experience in commodity management requiredMaster (5 plus years) experience in commodity negotiationsGlobal purchasing experience is preferredCommodity management experience with fluid power, dispense equipment, MRO, and software is preferredAnalytical, problem solver, and the ability to effectively communicate to all levels of the company required
